name: 狄雅南
objective: Advanced Engineering Mathematics (II) will be divided into four parts: (1) Linear algebra, (2) vector differential and integral calculus, (3) Fourier analysis, and (4) Partial differential equation.
schedule:
1st week: Linear Algebra and Vector Calculus (Part B)
2nd week: Matrices, Vectors Introduction
3rd week: Matrix Multiplication, Exercise
4th week: Exercise and Review
5th week: Linear Systems of Equations, Exercise
6th week: The Matrix Eigenvalue Problem. Determining Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors, Exercise
7th week: Vector in Spaces and Scalar
8th week: Review and Exercises
9th week: Midterm exam 
10th week: Fourier Analysis and Partial Differential Equation (Part C)
11th week: Fourier Series and Orthogonal Series, Exercise
12th week: Fourier Integral, Exercise
13th week: Fourier Transform (Discrete and Fast Fourier Transforms), Exercise
14th week: Partial Differential Equations, Exercise
15th week: Separating Variables, Use of Fourier Series
16th week: Review and problems exercise
17th week: Review and problems exercise
18th week: Final exam
scorePolicy:
Mid-term　　        　　　　                                40 %
Final Exam 　　　　　　　　                        40 %
Homework, Classroom participants (Q&A)　　20 %
materials: Kreyszig, E., Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 10th Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Singapore (2018).
remarks: Students can ask any time through the i-Plus system or offline discussions at Chemical Engineering-411. This course will use English. *Online course will be offered depend on pandemic situation.
